intro: Rhynchelythrum ruficomum, commonly known as the red-stemmed thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and woolly leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its reddish stems and spiny leaves are adaptations to reduce water loss and deter herbivores. Rhynchelythrum ruficomum is often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects.
